title: Marketplace Morning Report for Monday, June 10, 2013
itags: Marketplace Morning Report for Monday, June 10, 2013
byline: Scott Tong, Rob Schmitz, Mitchell Hartman, Shannon Mullen, Sam Beard, Mark Garrison, David Brancaccio and Bruce Johnson
teaser: The uproar over U.S. surveillance of Internet and telephone records could hit transatlantic trade. European lawmakers and privacy campaigners say the revelations might derail plans for a U.S.-EU free trade deal. President Obama and Chinese President Xi Jinping have finished their California summit. If there was a breakthrough, it wasn't on cybersecurity or trade -- it was on fighting climate change. And standing desks -- love 'em, hate 'em, gotta try 'em?
